alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 13 at 2:21PM MDT until June 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM TUESDAY FOR NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL NEW MEXICO AS WELL AS THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to southwest winds. low humidity and above normal temperatures will persist this afternoon. This will allow widespread critical fire weather conditions to continue into the early evening hours. Critical fire weather conditions will return on Tuesday across eastern and portions of north central New Mexico. A storm system will pass to our north Tuesday while a surface lee side low deepens across southeast Colorado. Though temperatures will lower slightly, strong southwest winds will result and very low humidity values will continue. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains, Northeast Plains and Highlands this afternoon through early evening, then again on Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph today. Southwest to west 20 to 25 mph with gusts to around 35 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 10 percent today and Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of these Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
